intro: Burmeistera crassifolia var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and collections.
